intro: Harpalyce rubicunda, commonly known as the redstem harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and prairies, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Harpalyce rubicunda is often found in disturbed habitats and can serve as a food source for certain wildlife.
